experience.title: The Burning Reef
experience.description: My final project dissertation for (Bsc) Digital Media at UWE. An interactive narative driven audio-visual experience for the web, generated using Three.JS to procedurally generate in WebGL the dynamic environment. The project is an exploration into the effects of a dynamic ambience meant to demonstrate the effects of ocean degradation and elicit and emotional response while they explore and collect artefacts related to the causes of the degradation. Effectiveness of the project was confirmed by qualitative and quantitative user research.
experience.roles: Javascript Developer, 3D Artist, User Experience Designer

experience.title: LIVE FEED
experience.description: A piece of Speculation design aiming to explore how the ownership of media portraying poverty might change given the creation of a system that would give control of the portrayal to those actually in poverty. A 3D interface streaming booth setup in a foodbank and an accompanying app prototype made in Figma allows those in poverty to safely present themselves to the general public through a media streaming platform

experience.title: Carbon Visualisation
experience.description: A data visualisation project created to visualise the varying carbon dioxide levels in the UK by retrieving values from a realtime API. The project also allows users to log their routine in travelling by road in order to collate all the results from all users throughout the day and see any potential correlation.

experience.title: Echo Architect
experience.description: An interactive game encouraging playful connections through the use of a puzzle-like interface where users must guess the code by identifying individual elements of a soundtrack. Made as an internet of Things project combining Arduino hardware for a physical interface and Javascript and ReactJS for the software interface. The project was aided by research in which we conducted user interviews on the types of interactions and genres of music users would find more enjoyable.
